channel.title: Canadian Computing Competition
channel.description:
I had this competition at my school, they gave us 3 hours to complete 5 programs. Pretty sure I did them all correctly.
i attached the scanned pages and the programs i wrote zipped (ye, they're all in java, but any language was acceptable so this doesn't really fit the java programming section)
discuss: how i did, what i did dumb, how you would approach these problems, etc
i had to upload problem 5 cause i cant attach anymore... http://s5.tinypic.com/2n1evfb.jpg & http://s5.tinypic.com/4t1pjb.jpg
also you can look at the competition website @ http://cemc.math.uwaterloo.ca/contests/computing.html

item.title: Canadian Computing Competition
item.dc:creator: @deadly72 deadly72
item.description:
@deadly72 wrote:

I have the same competition going on at my school today. Sadly I only got to make the first one work and this is junior too. Its more of a logic understanding competition compared to what you program.

This is my code to the first question in the Junior section

import java.util.Scanner;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class J1 {
	public static void main(String[] args) {
		Scanner keyboard = new Scanner(System.in);
		ArrayList<Integer> aList = new ArrayList<Integer>();
		
		for (int a = 0; a < 3; a++) {
			System.out.print("Digit "+(11+ a)+"? ");
			aList.add(keyboard.nextInt());
		}
		
		//91		
		int val1 = aList.get(0);
		int val2 = aList.get(1);
		int val3 = aList.get(2);
		
		val1 *= 1;
		val2 *= 3;
		val3 *= 1;
		
		int total = val1 + val2 + val3;
		total += 91;
		
		System.out.println("The 1-3-sum is "+ total);
	}
}

edit damn lawl, impressive work (my logic sucks so much compared to your work)… nice stuff edit
edit2 dammit, it pisses me off that I wasn’t able to get the logic as straight out as i see it in your work edit2

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

looks exactly like the ACM programming competition (which is targeted at tertiary education institutes) http://cm2prod.baylor.edu/

though it went for 8 hours and was 7 or so problems, was great except for only having 2 out of 3 people
